meanings.definition: The process in which rocks undergo changes in mineral composition and texture due to heat, pressure, or chemical reactions.
meanings.sent1: The metamorphism of the rocks was caused by intense heat.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study metamorphism to understand how rocks change over time.
meanings.sent3: The rocks decided to have a party and undergo metamorphism.
meanings.sent4: The metamorphism of the landscape turned ordinary rocks into jewels.
meanings.sent5: The metamorphism of the rocks was like a magical makeover, transforming them into something new and beautiful.

meanings.definition: The transformation of one form of rock into another through the alteration of mineralogy and texture.
meanings.sent1: During metamorphism, limestone can change into marble.
meanings.sent2: Metamorphism can create valuable resources like marble and slate.
meanings.sent3: The rock's metamorphism was so dramatic, it felt like a rock opera.
meanings.sent4: The metamorphism of the stone was a slow dance of change over centuries.
meanings.sent5: The metamorphism of the rock was a silent but powerful process, reshaping it into something entirely new.
